body:
I'd like to fix this. I think that the easy solution here is to add a "rescue" block to catch failures while waiting for reboot and assume that the reboot is then in progress. 
There are two obvious places to put this. One could place the error handling within `change_host_name.rb` which would fix this issue specifically. However it seems like it could probably better go in `vagrant\plugins\guests\windows\cap\reboot.rb` where it would handle any possible race condition in other places that are waiting for a reboot.  Places that use the `wait_for_reboot` capability include:
vagrant\plugins\provisioners\chef\provisioner\chef_client.rb -> run_chef_client
vagrant\plugins\provisioners\chef\provisioner\chef_solo.rb -> run_chef_solo
vagrant\plugins\provisioners\chef\provisioner\chef_zero.rb -> run_chef_zero
vagrant\plugins\provisioners\chef\provisioner\puppet.rb -> provision
vagrant\plugins\provisioners\shell\provisioner.rb -> provision_winrm

Any thoughts about why the error handling should or shouldn't be in reboot.rb? Or if any thoughts on if there is a better way to do this?

Here is a new instance of the error. This time it's a timeout:

Unfortunately this time I wasn't running as debug, so I don't have the full output. But the error should give some indication of where the timeout occurred.

You can 'cheat' repro this by shortening the reboot time in vagrant\plugins\guests\windows\cap\change_host_name.rb

  shutdown /r /t **1** /f /d p:4:1 /c "Vagrant Rename Computer"

Now seen with a WinRM::WinRMHTTPTransportError. 

```
==> kiosk2: Setting hostname...
C:/HashiCorp/Vagrant/embedded/gems/2.1.5/gems/winrm-2.2.3/lib/winrm/http/response_handler.rb:90:in `raise_transport_error': Bad HTTP response returned from server. Body(if present): (500). (WinRM::WinRMHTTPTransportError)
        from C:/HashiCorp/Vagrant/embedded/gems/2.1.5/gems/winrm-2.2.3/lib/winrm/http/response_handler.rb:54:in `raise_if_error'
        from C:/HashiCorp/Vagrant/embedded/gems/2.1.5/gems/winrm-2.2.3/lib/winrm/http/response_handler.rb:36:in `parse_to_xml'
        from C:/HashiCorp/Vagrant/embedded/gems/2.1.5/gems/winrm-2.2.3/lib/winrm/http/transport.rb:186:in `send_request'
        from C:/HashiCorp/Vagrant/embedded/gems/2.1.5/gems/winrm-2.2.3/lib/winrm/shells/power_shell.rb:44:in `close_shell'
        from C:/HashiCorp/Vagrant/embedded/gems/2.1.5/gems/winrm-2.2.3/lib/winrm/shells/base.rb:90:in `close'
        from C:/HashiCorp/Vagrant/embedded/gems/2.1.5/gems/winrm-2.2.3/lib/winrm/connection.rb:46:in `ensure in shell'
        from C:/HashiCorp/Vagrant/embedded/gems/2.1.5/gems/winrm-2.2.3/lib/winrm/connection.rb:46:in `shell'
        from C:/HashiCorp/Vagrant/embedded/gems/2.1.5/gems/vagrant-2.1.5/plugins/communicators/winrm/shell.rb:58:in `powershell'
        from C:/HashiCorp/Vagrant/embedded/gems/2.1.5/gems/vagrant-2.1.5/plugins/communicators/winrm/communicator.rb:148:in `execute'
        from C:/HashiCorp/Vagrant/embedded/gems/2.1.5/gems/vagrant-2.1.5/plugins/guests/windows/cap/reboot.rb:12:in `wait_for_reboot'
        from C:/HashiCorp/Vagrant/embedded/gems/2.1.5/gems/vagrant-2.1.5/lib/vagrant/capability_host.rb:111:in `call'
        from C:/HashiCorp/Vagrant/embedded/gems/2.1.5/gems/vagrant-2.1.5/lib/vagrant/capability_host.rb:111:in `capability'
        from C:/HashiCorp/Vagrant/embedded/gems/2.1.5/gems/vagrant-2.1.5/lib/vagrant/guest.rb:43:in `capability'
        from C:/HashiCorp/Vagrant/embedded/gems/2.1.5/gems/vagrant-2.1.5/plugins/guests/windows/cap/change_host_name.rb:36:in `change_host_name_and_wait'
        from C:/HashiCorp/Vagrant/embedded/gems/2.1.5/gems/vagrant-2.1.5/plugins/guests/windows/cap/change_host_name.rb:10:in `change_host_name'
...
```

I've made a pull request that addresses this issue: https://github.com/hashicorp/vagrant/pull/10347

Basically Vagrant attempted to figure out the guests `ssh_info` after the machine was requested to reboot. If the guest isn't up yet, the powershell script `get_network_config.ps1` fails and raises an exception. I've added some retry logic to continue to query for the guests IP until it's available. The timeout can be configured with an existing option that's used else where when first booting up the machine.

issue.title: Fixes #10229: Add proper reboot capability for Windows guests

repository.name: vagrant
repository.description: Vagrant is a tool for building and distributing development environments.

issue.body:
Prior to this commit, if Windows was slow to reboot, Vagrant would fail
to find the right IP address to upload the wait_for_reboot script to.
This commit fixes this race condition by adding a timeout to ensure that
Vagrant can retry. It also properly catches an exception in the winrm
ready? method for checking if a guest is properly ready for
communications.

body:
I'm going to lock this issue because it has been closed for _30 days_ . This helps our maintainers find and focus on the active issues.

If you have found a problem that seems similar to this, please open a new issue and complete the issue template so we can capture all the details necessary to investigate further.
